marketplaces.repo_description: Claude Code plugin for image generation with OpenAI

files.README.md:
# imagegen - Claude Code Plugin

Generate and edit images directly from Claude Code using OpenAI's image models (GPT-Image-1, DALL-E 2, DALL-E 3). Powered by [imagegen-mcp](https://github.com/spartanz51/imagegen-mcp).

## Prerequisites

- [Claude Code](https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code) installed
- [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/) v18+ (for `npx`)
- An [OpenAI API key](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys) with image generation access

## Installation

### Option 1: Install from This Marketplace (Recommended)

This repository serves as its own plugin marketplace. Add it to Claude Code, then install the plugin:

**Step 1: Add the marketplace**

Run Claude Code and use the `/plugins` command, then select **Manage marketplaces** and add this repository:

```
thorrak/imagegen-plugin
```

**Step 2: Install the plugin**

Once the marketplace is added, install the plugin:

```
/plugins install imagegen@imagegen-marketplace
```

Or browse interactively via `/plugins` > **Discover**.

### Option 2: Local Installation (Development)

Clone the repository and point Claude Code to it directly:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/thorrak/imagegen-plugin.git
claude --plugin-dir /path/to/imagegen-plugin
```

## Setup

Set your OpenAI API key as an environment variable:

```bash
export OPENAI_API_KEY="your-api-key-here"
```

Add this to your shell profile (`~/.bashrc`, `~/.zshrc`, etc.) to persist across sessions. The plugin's MCP server reads this variable automatically on startup.

## Usage

### Slash Commands

**Generate an image from a text prompt:**

```
/generate-image a minimalist weather app icon, flat design, blue gradient
/generate-image --model dall-e-3 --size 1792x1024 a panoramic mountain landscape
/generate-image --transparent a coffee shop logo, simple vector style
```

**Edit an existing image:**

```
/edit-image ./assets/logo.png change the background color to navy blue
/edit-image ./photo.png --mask ./mask.png replace the sky with a starry night
```

### Natural Language

You can also ask Claude conversationally — the plugin's skill activates automatically:

- "Generate an icon for my app"
- "Create a hero banner for the landing page"
- "Edit the logo to make the text larger"
- "Make a transparent PNG version of this image"

### Command Flags

Both commands support optional flags:

| Flag | Values | Default | Notes |
|------|--------|---------|-------|
| `--model` | `gpt-image-1`, `dall-e-2`, `dall-e-3` | `gpt-image-1` | |
| `--size` | e.g. `1024x1024`, `1792x1024` | `1024x1024` | Valid sizes vary by model |
| `--format` | `png`, `jpeg`, `webp` | `png` | |
| `--quality` | `auto`, `standard`, `hd` | `auto` | `hd` is DALL-E 3 only |
| `--transparent` | (flag, no value) | off | GPT-Image-1 + PNG/WebP only |
| `--n` | number | `1` | DALL-E 3 limited to 1 |

## Available Models

| Model | Best For | Editing | Transparent BG | Sizes |
|-------|----------|---------|----------------|-------|
| gpt-image-1 | General use, highest quality | Yes | Yes | 1024x1024, 1536x1024, 1024x1536 |
| dall-e-3 | Artistic/creative images | No | No | 1024x1024, 1792x1024, 1024x1792 |
| dall-e-2 | Quick drafts, low cost | Yes | No | 256x256, 512x512, 1024x1024 |

## Output

Generated images are saved to `./generated-images/` in your project directory with descriptive filenames (e.g., `weather-app-icon.png`, `hero-banner.png`).

## Plugin Components

| Component | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| **MCP Server** | Auto-starts `imagegen-mcp` via `npx` — connects to OpenAI's image APIs |
| **Skill** | Activates automatically when you discuss image generation — guides model selection, parameters, and prompting |
| **Commands** | `/generate-image` and `/edit-image` for quick, flag-based access |

## Troubleshooting

**MCP server fails to start:**
- Verify `OPENAI_API_KEY` is set: `echo $OPENAI_API_KEY`
- Verify Node.js is installed: `node --version` (v18+ required)
- Check that `npx` works: `npx --version`

**Image generation fails:**
- Check your OpenAI API key has image generation permissions
- Verify the requested size is valid for the chosen model (see table above)
- If you get a content policy error, try rephrasing your prompt

**Plugin not loading:**
- Run `/plugins` in Claude Code and verify `imagegen` is listed and enabled
- Restart Claude Code after installing the plugin

## Credits

Built on [imagegen-mcp](https://github.com/spartanz51/imagegen-mcp) by spartanz51.

marketplaces.name: pubmed-marketplace
marketplaces.description: PubMed biomedical literature research plugin for Claude Code

files.README.md:
# PubMed Plugin for Claude Code

A Claude Code plugin that integrates the [`@cyanheads/pubmed-mcp-server`](https://github.com/cyanheads/pubmed-mcp-server) MCP server, enabling biomedical literature search, article retrieval, citation formatting, and research planning directly within Claude Code.

## Features

- **Literature search** — search PubMed with full query syntax, MeSH terms, date ranges, and publication type filters
- **Article retrieval** — fetch full metadata, abstracts, author affiliations, and DOIs by PMID
- **Citation mapping** — find similar articles, papers that cite a work, and a paper's own references
- **Citation export** — format citations in BibTeX, RIS, APA, and MLA
- **Research planning** — generate structured systematic review plans with recommended search strings
- **Trend visualization** — create PNG charts of publication trends over time

## Prerequisites

- **Claude Code** — install with `npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code`
- **Node.js ≥ 20.0.0** — required to run the MCP server; [download here](https://nodejs.org/)
- **npx** — included with Node.js/npm
- **Internet access** — to reach the NCBI PubMed API

Verify your Node.js version:
```bash
node --version   # must be v20.0.0 or higher
```

## Installation

### Option 1: Marketplace (Recommended)

This repo is a Claude Code plugin marketplace. Add it once and install the plugin in seconds.

**Step 1: Add the marketplace**

In Claude Code, run `/plugins`, select **Manage marketplaces**, and add:

```
thorrak/pubmed_plugin
```

**Step 2: Install the plugin**

```
/plugins install pubmed@pubmed-marketplace
```

**Step 3: Restart Claude Code** (required for the MCP server to start)

**Step 4: Verify**

```
/pubmed:setup
```

---

### Option 2: Local / development install

Clone the repo and point Claude Code at it:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/thorrak/pubmed_plugin.git
cc --plugin-dir /path/to/pubmed_plugin
```

Or set it permanently in your Claude Code config:

```json
{
  "pluginDirs": ["/path/to/pubmed_plugin"]
}
```

### After installation

1. Restart Claude Code (required for MCP server to start)
2. Run `/mcp` in Claude Code — you should see a `pubmed` server listed with five tools
3. Run `/pubmed:setup` to verify everything is working

## Configuration

### NCBI API Key (Strongly Recommended)

Without an API key, NCBI limits requests to **3/second**. With one, the limit is **10/second**. For any serious research workload (systematic reviews, bulk fetches), the key is effectively required.

**Step 1: Create a free NCBI account**

Go to https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/ and sign up.

**Step 2: Generate an API key**

1. Sign in and go to **Account Settings**
2. Click **API Key Management**
3. Click **Create an API Key**
4. Copy the 36-character key

**Step 3: Set the environment variable**

Add to your shell profile (`~/.zshrc`, `~/.bashrc`, or `~/.profile`):

```bash
export NCBI_API_KEY="your_api_key_here"
```

Reload your shell:
```bash
source ~/.zshrc   # or ~/.bashrc
```

The MCP server reads `NCBI_API_KEY` automatically — no other configuration needed.

### MCP Server Version

The plugin is pinned to `@cyanheads/pubmed-mcp-server@1.4.5` in `.mcp.json`. To use a different version, edit `.mcp.json`:

```json
"args": ["-y", "@cyanheads/pubmed-mcp-server@<version>"]
```

### Verify Setup

Run the built-in diagnostic command in Claude Code:

```
/pubmed:setup
```

This performs four checks and reports results:

| Check | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| Node.js (≥20) | Verifies runtime is installed and meets version requirement |
| npx | Verifies package runner is available |
| NCBI API Key | Checks whether `NCBI_API_KEY` is set in the environment |
| MCP Connection | Attempts a live search to confirm the MCP server is running |

## Usage

Once installed, Claude automatically activates the PubMed skill when you ask research questions. No slash command needed for searches — just ask naturally.

### Example prompts

```
Search PubMed for recent randomized controlled trials on semaglutide in NASH
```

```
Find papers that cite PMID 35486828 and format them as BibTeX
```

```
Plan a systematic literature review on GLP-1 agonists and liver disease
```

```
Show me publication trends on mRNA vaccines from 2015 to 2024 as a bar chart
```

```
Get the full abstracts for PMIDs 35486828, 34577062, and 24475906
```

```
Find all papers similar to PMID 33264437 and export citations in APA format
```

## MCP Tools

The plugin exposes five tools from the PubMed MCP server (prefixed as `mcp__plugin_pubmed_pubmed__*`):

| Tool | Description |
|------|-------------|
| `pubmed_search_articles` | Search PubMed by query with filters, date ranges, and publication type |
| `pubmed_fetch_contents` | Retrieve full metadata and abstracts for known PMIDs |
| `pubmed_article_connections` | Find related/citing articles and export formatted citations |
| `pubmed_research_agent` | Generate structured systematic literature review plans |
| `pubmed_generate_chart` | Create PNG visualizations of publication data |

## Plugin Structure

```
pubmed_custom_plugin/
├── .claude-plugin/
│   └── plugin.json                    # Plugin manifest (name, version, metadata)
├── commands/
│   └── setup.md                       # /pubmed:setup diagnostic command
├── skills/
│   └── pubmed-research/
│       ├── SKILL.md                   # Core skill (auto-loads for PubMed queries)
│       └── references/
│           ├── tool-reference.md      # Complete parameter docs for all 5 tools
│           ├── research-workflows.md  # Six end-to-end workflow walkthroughs
│           └── setup-and-config.md    # NCBI key setup, advanced config, troubleshooting
├── .mcp.json                          # MCP server configuration (stdio transport)
├── .gitignore
├── LICENSE
└── README.md
```

## Troubleshooting

**MCP server not appearing in `/mcp`**
- Restart Claude Code after enabling the plugin — the MCP server starts at launch
- Verify Node.js ≥ 20 is installed: `node --version`
- Test the server manually: `npx -y @cyanheads/pubmed-mcp-server@1.4.5`
- Check Claude Code debug logs: `claude --debug`

**Rate limit errors during searches**
- Set `NCBI_API_KEY` (see Configuration above) — raises limit from 3 to 10 req/s
- Batch PMID fetches: pass multiple PMIDs in one `pubmed_fetch_contents` call
- Reduce `maxResults` for exploratory searches

**Node.js version too old**
- Check current version: `node --version`
- Upgrade at https://nodejs.org/ or via a version manager like `nvm`

**`npx` not found**
- Reinstall Node.js — npx is bundled with npm ≥ 5.2
- Or install separately: `npm install -g npx`

**Server crashes silently**
- Enable debug logging in `.mcp.json`: change `"MCP_LOG_LEVEL": "warning"` to `"debug"`
- Check logs directory if `LOGS_DIR` is configured

See `skills/pubmed-research/references/setup-and-config.md` for more detailed troubleshooting.

## License

Licensed under the [Apache License 2.0](LICENSE).

The `@cyanheads/pubmed-mcp-server` package is also licensed under Apache 2.0.
